title: With Solo Vehicle Testing Complete Flight 3 is Getting Closer
summary: Preparations for the third flight of Starship are making solid progress after both vehicles completed their respective solo test campaigns. Booster 10 rolled back to the Shipyard for final mods and checkouts before its flight, and Ship 28 wasn’t far behind. Both vehicles are now in their Bays for final work before rolling back to the launch site for integrated stack testing and launch.

title: As Vulcan nears debut, it’s not clear whether ULA will live long and prosper
summary: This marks an absolutely pivotal moment for the 20-year-old launch company.

title: Space security in the Americas can no longer go overlooked
summary: Countries in Latin America can no longer afford to ignore space as a major influence over national autonomy and security.

title: Daily Telescope: A crab found in the night sky rather than the world’s oceans
summary: Oh, to have seen this supernova back in the day.

title: China completes new commercial launch pad to boost access to space
summary: A newly-completed launch pad on China’s Hainan island could increase China’s access to space, boosting national constellation projects and commercial launch plans.
